question: Which among the following is commonlyÂ found in Gulf of Kutch, Gulf of Mannar, Andaman & Nicobar islands, & Lakshadweep?
explanation: A coral reef is a type of underwater ecosystem which is characterized by reef-building corals, formed of colonies of coral polyps by calcium carbonate. Coral reefs in India are found in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Gulf of Kutch, Gulf of Mannar, Lakshadweep, Netrani Island and some areas of Gulf of Khambat.
